data.title: No error message on failed plugin update in 1.5.1
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install ESLint plugin https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=dbaeumer.vscode-eslint (1.0.8 specified as latest version).
2. Note ESLint version at 1.0.7 and there's an update badge and update button for ESLint.
3. Update ESLint plugin and restart.
4. Version of ESLint plugin still at 1.0.7

I would expect VSCode to show a message specifying the min version the plugin supports or at least an error/warning message that the update failed.

After updating to 1.6.1 the plugin updates correctly.

data.title: LightBulb on top of line numbers when glyph margin disabled
data.body:
1. "editor.glyphMargin": false
2. Have a error that produces a quick fix
3. Notice the light bulb goes on top of editor line numbers
4. If I have glyphMargin disabled I would expect to never show the light bulb. Same as how we do not show breakpoints if a user has disabled the glyph margin

![screen shot 2016-10-17 at 16 48 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/19442566/fd80d8b6-9489-11e6-8bec-38c02c9d2ee3.png)

data.title: Request: Outline view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional (7601)

It would be great to have an Outline view, similar to Eclipse PHP where it is also possible navigate through methods even when in different files. In my point of view this is the only feature missing on this editor.

Take a look : http://help.eclipse.org/mars/index.jsp?topic=%2Forg.eclipse.platform.doc.user%2Fconcepts%2Fcoutline.htm

Thank you.

data.title: User user-friendly names for recommended extensions. @joao

data.title: --extensionHomePath seems broken and contradictary on Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Move extensions to temporary directory (from `%HOME%\.vscode\extensions` to `c:\temp\extensions`)
2. Run `code --listExtensions --extensionHomePath c:\temp\extensions` - verify list of extensions (that works)
3. Run `code --extensionHomePath c:\temp\extensions` - Code runs but no extensions are loaded. Contradicts last command.

Related issue: #9520

data.title: Snippets in 'launch.json'
data.body:
I would like to be able to contribute snippets for a 'launch.json' file from a debug extension. 
These snippets should only be available in 'launch.json' and not in any other .json file.

Currently each debug extension contributes a json schema which specifies what fields are required, the default values and so on.. Maybe this could somehow be used for the snippet support.

What would be the recommended way to get the snippet suport in 'launch.json'?

fyi @weinand @egamma

data.title: sort extensions list by name
data.body:
@spywhere 's contribution to #12910 sorts the initial list of extensions by name.

This PR adds an entry to the sort by menu so users can sort by name again in case they have sorted by installs or ratings.

data.title: Implement variable paging for named slots

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently variable paging is only implemented for indexed slots. Named slots are not paged at all.

I propose to implement variable paging for namedVariables as follows:
- keys are shown without square brackets.
- ranges are shown in the same way as for 'indexedVariables': [0..99]

Example:

```
o:
  [0..99]
    foo: "bar"
    xyz: 123
    abc: true

```

data.title: heuristic used in 'Add to Watch' does not always work
data.body:
### Description of the problem.

VS Code currently implements the 'Add to Watch' feature by taking the `name` property of the `Variable` and trying to combine them together. But this is not necessarily the correct name to evaluate. This is wrong for C# for root items due to our type annotations, and it can be wrong for child items any time that '.' isn't the right way to combine elements together.
### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install .NET Core, VS Code, and the C# extension (see http://aka.ms/vscclrdebugger for instruction)
2. Create hello world with `dotnet new`
3. Debug hello world and stop at the first line
4. Look at the locals window
5. Right click on `args` and invoke 'Add to Watch'

Result:
VS Code will add the name of the local (`args [string[]]`) which doesn't evaluate since we needed to add our type annotation.
### Suggested fix

`Variable` should have a new optional property for the evaluatable name. If that property is provided, Add to Watch should use this value instead. In VS, we call this value the 'full name'. For example, if `p` is a local pointer in C++, and `m_example` is a field, the full name for this would be `p->m_example`.

See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/73 for the corresponding protocol addition.

data.title: Cannot debug mocha/es6 tests
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the attached project [BugExample.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/532832/BugExample.zip)
2. Run  npm install
3. Open the project in VS Code
4. Put a breakpoint in L8 or L16 of ActionTest.test.js
5. Debug the test using the Launch configuration

The problem is that the test is run but the breakpoint is not hit. I think that this is related to the fact that the source maps are not loaded correctly but I don't undertand how to solve the problem.

Thank you for your help
Alessandro

data.title: Styling loss of entire file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions: gerane.Theme-ChromeDevTools-0.0.2, gerane.Theme-Github-0.0.2, gerane.Theme-Xcodedefault-0.0.2, HookyQR.beautify-0.2.1, saviorisdead.Theme-GitHubCleanWhite-0.0.3, SintrumIT.theme-oceanic-next-italic-1.1.14, ullissescastro.theme-bracketslight-1.0.2, zhuangtongfa.Material-theme-0.0.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create javascript file
2. Write code in the following way - 

``` javascript
var i = 0;
for(; i<selectedindex.length -1; i++) {
  data = data[selectedindex[i]].children;
}
```

Note that selectedindex, data are defined in my code.
3. After this syntax all code following it will be single color.

data.title: Preserve past output after running Ctrl-L in terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7 Insider
- OS: macOS 10.11.6

Currently Ctrl-L clears all output from terminal. You can't scroll up to find past output.
iTerm and gnome-terminal all handle Ctrl-L by clearing the screen while preserving output, so later you can still scroll up to find it.

data.title: Custom configuration with extension testing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

From https://github.com/SamVerschueren/vscode-final-newline/issues/12#issuecomment-254127218

I want to test my extension. The extension only activates when the setting `files.insertFinalNewline` is set to `true`. But how can I do this while testing the extension? It doesn't seem you can launch the Extension Host with preconfigured custom settings. Also their doesn't seem to be an utility function to do this.
